cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles (225 km) south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross Hispaniola, the southeastern Bahamas, then turn northward toward the Florida peninsula and later the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern or southeastern Florida coast (after passing through the Bahamas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for portions of the central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands westward across all of Hispaniola, Turks and Caicos, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, southeastern Bahamas, Florida peninsula, and eventually the southeast U.S. coastline through South Carolina/Georgia within 5 days
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: DANVILLE VA (closest listed point in NHC table, ~275 km south-south-west of Philadelphia)
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at the port within the 5-day window
weather_observation.wind: Low confidence of any sustained tropical-storm-force winds at the port; probabilities remain below 5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated – system forecast to be well south of Delaware Bay within 5 days
weather_observation.rainfall: Only light, peripheral rain bands possible late Day-5/Day-6 if the storm accelerates northward
weather_observation.other_hazards: Indirect impacts such as upstream cargo delays from Caribbean/Florida ports may occur before any direct weather reaches Philadelphia
